Led by (name of the leading entity): Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Goals / Motivations: "facilitate rapid public health responses by overcoming barriers to data integration and exploration in molecular epidemiology"
Credited Contributions: communication; curation; data analysis; development; leadership; research

Goals / Motivations: "identifying the relationships among a user's newly sequenced viral genomes and all known SARS-CoV-2 virus genomes"
Challenges: data availability

Led by (name of the leading entity): Áine O'Toole and the Rambaut Lab (University of Edinburgh)
Goals / Motivations: "allows a user to assign a SARS-CoV-2 genome sequence the most likely lineage (Pango lineage) to SARS-CoV-2 query sequences"
Challenges: reliance on manual updates and maintenance

Goals / Motivations: " helping policymakers and funders to maximise timely, quality data sharing and appropriate responses in such health emergencies"

"Allows the worldwide AI research community the opportunity to apply text and data mining approaches to find answers to questions within, and connect insights across, this content in support of the ongoing COVID-19 response efforts worldwide"
Challenges: keeping data up-to-date, handling data from multiple sources, cleaning metadata, providing machine readable text, observing copyright restrictions

Goals / Motivations: "enables users within and outside NIH to explore and analyze the rapidly growing set of advances in COVID‑19 research as they accumulate in real time, and complements efforts by NLM to aggregate full text documents broadly related to COVID-19 and other outbreaks"

Led by (name of the leading entity): National Institutes of Health (NIH) and PubMed
Goals / Motivations: "tracking up-to-date scientific information about the 2019 novel Coronavirus"
Challenges: triaging papers into relevant categories as research evolves, assessing quality and validity of papers
Notes: Human review ended June 2023. All relevant articles are being classified computationally.

Goals / Motivations: "gathering the latest international multilingual scientific findings and knowledge on COVID-19"
"enable the scientific community to discover research from different sources around Europe and the world"
Notes: Copy of curation decisions (previously on website, but since removed)

Goals / Motivations: "meet the needs of the healthcare information community in a time when information is released at a rapid rate, from all areas of the knowledge ecosystem"
Challenges: need for librarians and information professionals

Goals / Motivations: "support healthcare professionals, medical researchers and the public"
"collect Wikidata resources related to COVID-19"
Challenges: excessive vandalism

Led by (name of the leading entity): European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) and World Health Organization (WHO)
Goals / Motivations: "provide a concise overview of the epidemiological situation of the COVID-19 pandemic and vaccine uptake by country"
unknown
"synthesizes findings from thousands of COVID-19 seroprevalence studies worldwide"
Challenges: "timeliness of study implementation, data analysis and reporting"
Credited Contributions: curation; data analysis; development; leadership; research

Goals / Motivations: "provides an overview of SARS-CoV-2 variants and mutations that are of interest"
"provide a frequently updated data visualization, data dissemination and data exploration resource, while linking users to other useful and informative resources"
Challenges: local differences in case detection, definitions, testing strategies, reporting practice, and lag times

Goals / Motivations: "collecting and publishing the data required to understand the COVID-19 outbreak in the United States"
Credited Contributions: communication; curation; data analysis; development; leadership

Goals / Motivations: "provides the cumulative number of confirmed COVID-19 cases and deaths, as well as the rate of daily COVID-19 cases and deaths by country, income, region, and globally"
Challenges: changing availability of data sources, slow load times due to volume of data

Goals / Motivations: "achieve a unified and comprehensive view of the current global state of infectious diseases and their effect on human and animal health"

Led by (name of the leading entity): University of Oxford and Global Change Data Lab
Goals / Motivations: "make data and research accessible so that we can achieve progress against the world’s largest problems"
Challenges: data quality decline over time, varying protocols and challenges in the attribution of the cause of death

Goals / Motivations: "provides a unique way of examining data curated by different data sources"
Challenges: quality decline due decrease in supporting data sources; data reliability and consistency; amount of work

Goals / Motivations: "enables users to track both the global and local trends of Novel Coronavirus infection since Jan 21st, 2020"
Challenges: manual quality review

Goals / Motivations: "provide the latest, most complete, and accurate information by using data from multiple reputable sources around the world"
Challenges: stability of data over time, consistency between sources, missing data in certain regions

Goals / Motivations: "track the pandemic's impact and inform policy making"
Challenges: data limitations, dependence on other data infrastructures

Goals / Motivations: "Provide researchers, public health authorities, and the general public with a user friendly tool to track the outbreak as it unfolds"
Challenges: declining quality of data due to at-home testing; unstable, ambiguous, untransparent source materials

Led by (name of the leading entity): Institute For Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME)
Goals / Motivations: "help hospitals and policymakers plan how to allocate resources"
Challenges: data limitations and irregularities, data access

Goals / Motivations: "Enabling rapid and open access to epidemic and pandemic virus data"
Notes: Covid launch: 01/10/2020; *GISAID guides users to cite one of three papers when using their data. We report the citation counts for "GISAID’s Role in Pandemic Response," which specifically deals with GISAID's work on COVID-19

Goals / Motivations: "provide real-world data and related software tools to researchers from any sector; including non-profit, grant-funded, and both industry and commercially funded research and public health activities concerning COVID-19"
Notes: 56 research papers that use the data are reported on the database website

Goals / Motivations: "help public health professionals, researchers, policymakers and others in understanding and managing the virus"
Challenges: ensure global representation, use of volunteers

Goals / Motivations: "aid epidemiological understanding of pathogen spread and evolution and improve outbreak response"

Led by (name of the leading entity): Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS)
Goals / Motivations: unknown
"provide insights into what changed in response to policies aimed at combating COVID-19"
Challenges: preserving privacy, variance in population over time

Goals / Motivations: "provide an earlier and more accurate indication of the reemergence of the virus in different parts of the country", help identify secondary health effects of the pandemic
Challenges: maintaining quality and privacy threshholds

Goals / Motivations: "provide helpful insights to local governments and health authorities and may also be used as a foundation for new public policies by showing the change in volume of people driving, walking or taking public transit in their communities"
Challenges: privacy, data volume by region

Led by (name of the leading entity): Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research (ICPSR)

Led by (name of the leading entity): Emily Chen, Kristina Lerman, Emilio Ferrara
Goals / Motivations: unknown

Goals / Motivations: "facilitates data sharing and analysis in order to accelerate coronavirus research"

Notes: Started to end project at the end of 2022
